de.wwu.muggl.vm.initialization
Class Objectref

java.lang.Object
  de.wwu.muggl.vm.initialization.FieldContainer
      de.wwu.muggl.vm.initialization.Objectref
All Implemented Interfaces:
ReferenceValue
public class Objectref
extends FieldContainer
implements ReferenceValue

This class represents a concrete instance of a ClassFile. It especially offers access to the instance fields, as well as means of wrapping java objects to an objectref and of extracting the fields of object references to insert them into java objects.

Version:
1.0.0, 2010-03-10
Author:
Tim Majchrzak

Constructor Detail

Objectref

public Objectref(InitializedClass staticReference,
                 boolean primitiveWrapper)
Private constructor to get concrete instances of an initialized class. These instances have a reference to the InitializedClass, which keeps control of the static fields. The concrete instance itself keeps control of instance fields.

Parameters:
staticReference - The InitializedClass (which has been generated by the ClassFile).
primitiveWrapper - Toggles the usage of the Objectref as a wrapper for primitive types.
Method Detail

getMonitor

public Monitor getMonitor()
Getter for the monitor associated with this objectref.

Returns:
The monitor associated with this objectref (might be null if there is no such one).

setMonitor

public void setMonitor(Monitor monitor)
Sets the monitor to be associated with this objectref. This will only work if there currently is no monitor associated.

Parameters:
monitor - The monitor that will be associated with this objectref.

Returns:
true, if the supplied object is equal to this object reference, false otherwise.
See Also:
Object.equals(java.lang.Object)

equals

public boolean equals(Objectref objectref)
Check if the supplied object reference is equal to this object reference. Equality is given if
  • the represented class of the static reference is equal,
  • there is the same number of static fields, each field exists in both references and it has the same value and
  • there is the same number of instance fields, each field exists in both references and it has the same value.

Parameters:
objectref - The object reference to check equality with.
Returns:
true, if the supplied object reference is equal to this object reference, false otherwise.
